docs.lead_paragraph: While many Americans have always given generously, many wealthy people and foundations donate to art museums, hospital wings or political causes.

headline.seo: Donors Weigh the Most Worthy Ways to Give to Charities
headline.main: Donors Weigh the Ideals of Meaningful Giving

docs.abstract: Philanthropy and how it is carried out are being questioned more closely as the number of Americans in need grow; charitable giving has increased, but most donations go toward art museums, hospital wings or political causes, not to the ranks of the needy.
docs.snippet: While many Americans have always given generously, many wealthy people and foundations donate to art museums, hospital wings or political causes.

headline.main: Is China Facing a Health Care Crisis?

docs.abstract: Despite the government's effort to stimulate consumer spending, ordinary Chinese feel pressure to save money for medical expenses.
docs.snippet: Despite the government's effort to stimulate consumer spending, ordinary Chinese feel pressure to save money for medical expenses.

headline.main: Study: Few Hospitals Qualify for Digital Funds

docs.abstract: About 10 percent of the nation's hospitals meet criteria that would enable them to qualify for extra payments under Medicare and Medicaid.
docs.snippet: About 10 percent of the nation's hospitals meet criteria that would enable them to qualify for extra payments under Medicare and Medicaid.

docs.lead_paragraph: Though hospitals are eligible for billions of dollars in federal stimulus money to bring their facilities into the digital age to save money and improve the quality of health care, just one in 10 is ready to meet government standards to qualify for the funds, a new analysis shows.

headline.main: Study: Few Hospitals Qualify for Digital Funds

docs.abstract: About 10 percent of the nation's hospitals meet criteria that would enable them to qualify for extra payments under Medicare and Medicaid.
docs.snippet: About 10 percent of the nation's hospitals meet criteria that would enable them to qualify for extra payments under Medicare and Medicaid.

docs.lead_paragraph: In paying the full amounts A.I.G. owed financial companies, the New York Fed disregarded the expectations of senior Fed officials in Washington.

headline.seo: G.A.O. Says New York Fed Failed to Push A.I.G. Concessions
headline.main: Report Says New York Fed Didn’t Cut Deals on A.I.G.
headline.print_headline: Report Says New York Fed Didn’t Cut Deals on A.I.G.

docs.abstract: Government Accountability Office report raises questions about the Federal Reserve Bank of New York's handling of the 2008 bailout of American International Group; says that in paying the full amounts AIG owed financial companies, the New York Fed disregarded the expectations of senior Fed officials in Washington.
docs.snippet: In paying the full amounts A.I.G. owed financial companies, the New York Fed disregarded the expectations of senior Fed officials in Washington.

keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: It is three weeks to deadline, and the deficit-cutting panel isn’t close to an agreement. Democrats are willing to cut, but Republicans won’t give an inch on taxes.
docs.abstract: Editorial lambastes Republicans in Congress for their unwillingness to compromise with Democrats to make a plan to reduce the federal deficit by at least 1.2 trillion before the November 23 deadline; argues that the Republicans, who reject any plan that involves tax increases, clearly care more about protecting corporations and the wealthy than they do about the nation's overall economic health.
docs.snippet: It is three weeks to deadline, and the deficit-cutting panel isn’t close to an agreement. Democrats are willing to cut, but Republicans won’t give an inch on taxes.

keywords.value: Joint Select Committee on Deficit Reduction
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The health insurer Humana said it expected 2011 earnings of $8.35 to $8.40 a share, which is up from previous guidance of $7.50 to $7.60 a share.

headline.seo: Humana Raises Its Forecast as Profit Climbs 13%
headline.main: Profit Rises at Humana, and So Does Its Forecast
headline.print_headline: Profit Rises At Humana, And So Does Its Forecast

docs.abstract: Health insurer Humana says it expects 2011 earnings of $8.35 to $8.40 a share, up from previous guidance of $7.50 to $7.60 a share; reports earnings for third quarter of $444.7 million, or $2.67 a share, compared with $393.2 million, or $2.32 a share a year earlier; revenue in the quarter climbed 11 percent, to $9.3 billion.
docs.snippet: The health insurer Humana said it expected 2011 earnings of $8.35 to $8.40 a share, which is up from previous guidance of $7.50 to $7.60 a share.
